gameRecap.title: Game Recap: Celtics 155, Pacers 104
gameRecap.excerpt: The Celtics put up 153+ points for the first time since 1970 as they defeated the Pacers, 155-104. Jayson Tatum led the way for the Celtics with 30 points, 12 rebounds and four assists, while Derrick White added 18 points and four assists in the victory. T.J. McConnell tallied 18 points, seven rebounds and five assists for the Pacers in the losing effort. The Celtics improve to 4-0 on the season, while the Pacers fall to 2-2.
